result.execSummary:
The defendant Ezra C Ladwig Hendricks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to complete an alcohol and drug abuse assessment (AODA) and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to complete and submit proof of completion to the Clerk of Courts Office and the District Attorney's Office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

from Clerk to Defendant re: Warrant
No Appearance by Defendant.  Court orders Warrant.
FTP Hearing 05-16-2016 for $479.00

8:58 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court recites agreement  - upon plea to the charge, will recommend a fine and costs, AODA and DNA sample.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs, is accepting the offer.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$100 fine plus court costs -  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-AODA & any follow-up - to be completed within 60 days and proof to be filed in the Clerk of Courts office and DA's office.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 9:04 a.m.
Settlement Form (PTC)
Initial appearance at 01-19-2016 08:30 am

Defendant called and requested an adjournment.  Adjourned to January 19, 2016 at 8:30 a.m.  Address on file is correct.
